title: Drawing, "Man the Hunter, Man the Shepherd, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza", 1787–1802
medium: Pen and ink, brush and greyish-brown wash over black chalk on laid paper
markings: Watermark: partially visible, two lilies in double oval, over letter G
inscribed: Inscription in two ovals: L'omo cacciatore, L'omo pastore.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Young man in pose of Apollo, standing over carcass, points bow toward stag running in right distance. Inscription: L'omo cacciatore.  At right, shepherd, wearing Phrygian cap, blows pan flute. Cattle at right. Inscription: L'omo pastore.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Man the Hunter, Man the Shepherd, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza", 1787–1802.
1787–1802. Pen and ink, brush and greyish-brown wash over black chalk on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3435.
